# utils.descriptors.ValidDataFrame { #caml.utils.descriptors.ValidDataFrame }

`utils.descriptors.ValidDataFrame(self, strict=False)`

Descriptor class that allows setting and getting a value that must be a valid DataFrame
of type pandas.DataFrame, polars.DataFrame, pyspark.sql.DataFrame, or ibis.expr.types.relations.TableExpr.

## Parameters

| Name     | Type   | Description                                                                                                                                                            | Default   |
|----------|--------|------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|-----------|
| `strict` |        | If True, the value must be a pandas.DataFrame, polars.DataFrame, pyspark.sql.DataFrame, or ibis.expr.types.relations.TableExpr. If False, None is an acceptable value. | `False`   |

## Raises

| Type       | Description                                     |
|------------|-------------------------------------------------|
| ValueError | If the assigned value is not a valid data type. |
